image.altText: A road, viewed from above, is covered in leaves and tree branches.

props.synopsis: The rare November cyclone, with wind gusts at its core reaching almost 200km/h, pushed over massive trees and damaged homes, cars and infrastructure when it passed Darwin at the weekend. These are the scenes from Cyclone Fina's impact.

title.children: Trees toppled, cars crushed, thousands without power: TC Fina in pictures

image.altText: Laura sits outside and looks seriously into the camera.

props.synopsis: A new report by victim-led advocacy organisation With You We Can makes the case for all victim-survivors of sexual violence to have access to independent legal representation.

title.children: Laura felt unsupported in the justice system. She wants that to change

image.altText: A profile image of Md Isfaqur Rahman wearing a white shirt, tie and jacket.

props.synopsis: The week-long murder trial of Brendan Kantilla, charged over the death of Bangladeshi student Md Isfaqur Rahman in 2023, has begun in the Northern Territory Supreme Court in Darwin.

title.children: Trial of man accused of murdering 23yo international student begins in Darwin

image.altText: A tree has fallen over the fence of a remote home, it is lying over a power line nearby.

props.synopsis: While Darwin experienced the outer edge of Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina this weekend, the eye of the storm came much closer to the Tiwi Islands. Locals in Wurrumiyanga share their experiences with the ABC.

title.children: Tiwi Islanders tell of 'pretty terrifying' night as Fina battered their homes

image.altText: Hail next to a hand

props.synopsis: About 90,000 Queenslanders are still without power after giant hailstones, destructive winds and intense lightning lashed parts of the state, with more extreme weather on the way.

title.children: 90,000 Queenslanders still without power after giant hail and fierce winds

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands convicted child murderer Bevan Spencer von Einem has been taken to the Yatala infirmary in Adelaide where he only has a short time to live.

title.children: Child murderer Bevan Spencer von Einem in serious condition

image.altText: A stylised image of the ASX trading board

props.synopsis: The ASX is poised to follow US stocks higher. Drivers working in the gig economy for Uber Eats and DoorDash may soon be earning a minimum wage if a deal with the union is passed by the Fair Work Commission. Follow live.Â

title.children: Australian shares poised to follow Wall St higher as rebound rally rolls on

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Economy 'about to crash through its speed limit', rates may rise in 2026, warns CBA
Would minimum wage deal increase Uber Eats, Door Dash costs?

image.altText: Pauline Hanson wearing a burka walks out of the Senate with members of One Nation.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's decision to wear a burka in the Senate for the second time in her political career is met with widespread condemnation from all sides of politics. Follow live.

title.children: Hanson slammed for 'headline-grabbing' burka stunt

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ley's leadership safe for now as Liberals avoid partyroom spill

Hanson burka stunt 'abhorrent' and left senators feeling 'unsafe': Payman

image.altText: A close up photo shows the face of Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: China's escalating confrontation with Japan is colliding directly with its attempt to join one of the world's most demanding trade agreements.

title.children: China's confrontation with Japan undermines its own economic interests

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: In their effort to find missing four-year-old Gus, police have vowed "explore every avenue" â€” which now includes several mine shafts around the property where he disappeared.

title.children: Gus search to begin as police vow to 'explore every avenue'

image.altText: Colourful stalls of different crypto companies with many punters asking questions.

props.synopsis: It's been a wild ride for bitcoin traders in recent months and, after a weekend of crypto and blockchain enthusiasm at a Sydney convention, sceptics continue to flag the risks.

title.children: 'Contagion' fears surface as bitcoin crash unsettles financial markets

props.synopsis: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

title.children: 'These are real humans': More mental health patients ending up in EDs

image.altText: An illustration of a woman in pain, holding her head

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 people got in touch directly with the ABC to share their experiences with migraine and now the experts have weighed in.

title.children: The myths and truths of living with migraine

image.altText: Caleb sitting on the beach digging a hole in the sand smiling.

props.synopsis: An 84-year-old woman is facing charges including fail to render assistance following the fatal collision west of Geelong in March.

title.children: Elderly woman charged over alleged hit-run crash that killed 6yo boy

image.altText: Marilyn Warren, who has short brown hair, poses for a photo wearing a cream blazer

props.synopsis: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

title.children: She was a trailblazer for women in law. Her gender was, at times, a burden

image.altText: A woman stands outside a cafe

props.synopsis: While Porepunkah residents are trying to move on from the tragic deaths of two police officers, there is one person they are eager to forget.

title.children: As Porepunkah tries to move on, one name remains too painful to hear

image.altText: An older man with thinning grey hair wears a dark suit as he stands and speaks.

props.synopsis: Macarthur MP Mike Freelander believes the multi-partisan support for restricting gambling advertising means the reforms will "get there" eventually.

title.children: Gambling ad ban would pass parliament with conscience vote, Labor MP says

image.altText: AI child abuse phone generic

props.synopsis: His crimes were so disturbing some police sources described it as the worst case of child abuse material they have ever seen in their careers. The man at the centre of it could be released next year.

title.children: Sydney man behind 'absolutely abhorrent' child abuse revealed as suburban architect

image.altText: NSW Police attend a fatal stabbing at Rouse Hill

props.synopsis: NSW Police said two young boys were at a reserve at Rouse Hill when they were approached by three other boys about 4:20pm on Monday.

title.children: 15yo boy charged with murder after teen dies in Sydney stabbing

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they leave after a bilateral meeting in South Korea

props.synopsis: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

title.children: Taiwan's 'return to China' key to international order, Xi tells Trump

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding signs while marching in front of Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: Parents and guardians have been asked to "make alternative plans" for their children as Queensland teachers walk off the job after rejecting pay offer.

title.children: 'Thank the premier': Teachers strike across Qld for second time this year

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing black, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns his country's borders "cannot be changed by force", highlighting a key sticking point in negotiations with the US over a potential peace deal with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy warns Ukraine's borders 'cannot be changed by force'

image.altText: Idrissa Gueye of Everton clashes with teammate Michael Keane during a Premier League match.

props.synopsis: Idrissa Gueye is involved in a heated moment with Michael Keane during Everton's Premier League match against Manchester United.

title.children: Everton player sent off for slapping teammate during Premier League match

image.altText: Open cut coal mine

props.synopsis: Yancoal begins plans to extend the life of its central Queensland coal mine, which would see roughly 74 million tonnes of coal extracted over the life of the mine.Â

title.children: Chinese-backed mining company looks to extend coal mine to 2070

image.altText: eva copper sign on outback mine site

props.synopsis: South Africa's largest gold producer, Harmony Gold, has officially signed off on a significant outback copper mine that is set to boost Queensland's economy by $17 billion.

title.children: South Africa's largest gold producer greenlights a $2.4 billion Qld copper mine

image.altText: A person sits in a cell, as seen through a heavy door with a barred viewing window in it.

props.synopsis: The family of a dying man asked for his records from Tasmania's only youth detention centre, Ashley. They were told it could take eight months â€” time he does not have.

title.children: Terminally ill man in race against time to access records of child imprisonment

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair in a pink shirt and black skirt stands with her arm around a man in a blue shirt in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Stunt pilot Glenn Collins says he is excited but daunted as he faces "the biggest rehab of my life â€” going home".

title.children: Avalon Airshow stunt show pilot returns home eight months after crash

image.altText: A pregnant stomach in focus with a midwife in the background at a desk

props.synopsis: A free "gold standard" antenatal care program is proving hugely popular and successful, but women are scrambling to get access.

title.children: Thousands of women missing out on 'gold standard' antenatal care

image.altText: Roger Cook smiling and gesturing to a poster advertising plans for Burswood Park.

props.synopsis: The WA government will be hoping its second crack at rebranding this project will capture the public's imagination, or it may be back to the drawing board.Â

title.children: Racetrack no longer has pole position in government's 'Perth Park' project

image.altText: A low wide shot of a fluffy brown dog on a leash which looks huge compared to the silhouetted person sitting on a beach.

props.synopsis: Animals and objects dwarf humans in Gavin Libotte's unique perspective on suburban life, challenging the way we see the familiar world.

title.children: 'Magic in the mundane' for Sydney photographer unearthing childlike wonder

image.altText: A man pushes a stretcher with a woman wrapped in an orange blanket into the back of an ambulance

props.synopsis: Temple staff in Thailand were shocked when the woman began knocking from the coffin.

title.children: Woman found alive in coffin at crematorium in Thailand

image.altText: Ash Riddell and Jasmine Garner sitting together at W Awards.

props.synopsis: Ash Riddell says her close relationship with North Melbourne teammate Jasmine Garner helped her win the AFLW's best and fairest award.

title.children: Riddell credits Roos teammate after winning AFLW's top individual honour
